title: Vintage Sailing & Regattas
description: Set sail on a voyage through the golden age of yachting, regattas, and maritime recreation from the mid-20th century!

questions.question: The America's Cup, the oldest trophy in international sport, was successfully defended by the United States for how many consecutive years before Australia won in 1983?
Which Australian yacht broke America's 132-year winning streak in the America's Cup in 1983?
President John F. Kennedy was an avid sailor. He famously sailed which type of boat off Cape Cod?
Sir Francis Chichester made headlines in 1967 by completing what remarkable solo sailing achievement?
options: Crossing the Atlantic in record time

questions.question: The Sunfish sailboat, introduced in the 1950s, became hugely popular for recreational sailing because of what characteristic?
options: Its ability to sail in storms

questions.question: Newport, Rhode Island served as the home port for America's Cup races for many decades. In which body of water were races held?

Which classic wooden sailboat class, popular since the 1920s, features a distinctive star-shaped emblem on its sail?
Ted Turner, later famous as a media mogul, won the America's Cup in 1977 as skipper of which yacht?
The Bermuda Race, one of sailing's most prestigious ocean races, runs between Bermuda and which U.S. city?
Which small sailboat, first produced by Alcort in 1947, became one of the most popular learn-to-sail boats in America?
The Sydney to Hobart yacht race, one of the world's great ocean races, takes place in which month?
